page.title: 06West Hall Farm
page.content: In autumn the farming year starts with harvesting the barley and storing it in a large barn.We cut hedges for people who plant winter barley.Then the barley fields are ploughed for the frost to break down the soil. The cattle are brought into sheds for winter and fed on silage.Hay is fed to the sheep if the snow is deep (which often happens in this area).We have 22 cows and 70 sheep (ewes). In spring the ewes have their lambs, increasing our stock to about 140.Our ram is a Suffolk.Manure is spread on the fields along with fertilizer to improve the soil. In summer we employ 2 extra people(We employ only 1 permanent person during the year) to help with the hay.For the silage a forage harvester picks up the grass,chops it and transfers it to trailers to be led to the farm.
